    • Method Detail

      • equalTo

        public static BooleanDataset equalTo(Object a,
                     Object b)
        Compare item-wise for whether a's element is equal b's

        For multi-element items, comparison is true if all elements in an item are equal. Where the datasets have mismatched item sizes, the first element of the dataset with smaller items is used for comparison.

        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        dataset where item is true if a == b

      • equalTo

        public static BooleanDataset equalTo(Object a,
                     Object b,
                     BooleanDataset o)
        Compare item-wise for whether a's element is equal b's

        For multi-element items, comparison is true if all elements in an item are equal. Where the datasets have mismatched item sizes, the first element of the dataset with smaller items is used for comparison.

        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        o - output can be null - in which case, a new dataset is created
        Returns:
        dataset where item is true if a == b

      • almostEqualTo

        public static BooleanDataset almostEqualTo(Object a,
                           Object b,
                           double relTolerance,
                           double absTolerance)
        Compare item-wise for whether a's element is equal b's

        For multi-element items, comparison is true if all elements in an item are equal. Where the datasets have mismatched item sizes, the first element of the dataset with smaller items is used for comparison.

        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        relTolerance -
        absTolerance -
        Returns:
        dataset where item is true if abs(a - b) <= absTol + relTol*max(abs(a),abs(b))

      • isClose

        public static final boolean isClose(double a,
              double b,
              double relTol,
              double absTol)
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        relTol -
        absTol -
        Returns:
        true if abs(a - b) <= max(absTol, relTol*max(abs(a),abs(b)))

        Compare item-wise for whether a's element is equal b's

        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        o - output can be null - in which case, a new dataset is created
        relTolerance -
        absTolerance -
        Returns:
        dataset where item is true if abs(a - b) <= absTol + relTol*max(abs(a),abs(b))

      • allCloseTo

        public static boolean allCloseTo(Object a,
                 Object b,
                 double relTolerance,
                 double absTolerance)
        Compare item-wise for whether a's element is almost equal to b's

        For multi-element items, comparison is true if all elements in an item are equal up to a tolerance. Where the datasets have mismatched item sizes, the first element of the dataset with smaller items is used for comparison.

        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        relTolerance -
        absTolerance -
        Returns:
        true if all items satisfy abs(a - b) <= absTol + relTol*max(abs(a),abs(b))

        Negate item-wise

        For multi-element items, negation is false if all elements in a pair of items are true.

        Returns:

      • logicalAnd

        public static BooleanDataset logicalAnd(Object a,
                        Object b)
        Compare item-wise for whether a's item is true and b's true too.

        For multi-element items, comparison is true if all elements in a pair of items are true. Where the datasets have mismatched item sizes, the first element of the dataset with smaller items is used for comparison.

        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        dataset where item is true if a && b is true

      • logicalOr

        public static BooleanDataset logicalOr(Object a,
                       Object b)
        Compare item-wise for whether a's item is true or b's true.

        For multi-element items, comparison is true if any elements in a pair of items are true. Where the datasets have mismatched item sizes, the first element of the dataset with smaller items is used for comparison.

        Parameters:

        b -
        Returns:
        dataset where item is true if a || b is true

        public static BooleanDataset logicalXor(Object a,

        Parameters:

        b -
        Returns:
        dataset where item is true if a ^ b is true
